column5: I am going to try for whitefish for the first time and would appreciate a little help. I am going to be launching at Innisfill beach park. How long will it take to get to Willow Beach? Do I go in between Fox and Snake or is there a better way. What depth? do you start shallow and work your way deeper. Any info would be great, like I said this is the first time for me out there. I have a 16ft crestliner with a 50hp merc. I should be okay as long as the wind isn't too bad right!!  Thanks Scooter
go between the 2 islands  about 8 km and you will see all the boats
Once you get a lil closer to the pack pull out your binoculars if you can spot a boat catching lots pull up as close as you can drop anchor and start fishing.
I can't stand people that do this, lol!!  But yeah, find the floatilla and join the fun.
Maybe just ask if you can tie off to there boat.  It will save you putting an anchor down.
you can be anchor boy tomorrow.
or leave ur boat and hop in to that boat save you the trouble... )

for the record, I didn't tell him to go to the boats....... I prefer to be a km away from the pack..........  but I have years of way points and that's where I fish, whether there are boats there or not

LOL sorry guys should have used the  icon instead LOL. Ya its sad but what i descibed seems to be common pratice. My buddy and I fish miles away from the JP/Willow beach zoo and still catch fish. Imagine that. Hopefully be out tomorrow morning balls deep trolling around the north end of the lake....
Imagine that eh?!?!..
I still got all my sneaky ice GPS way points for Sat, should be a great day!!!   No way we'll be sitting in the middle of the floatilla of rubes!
Always looking for an Edge ehh Glen
Dang,if I only had my boat,I would be the only guy jigg,n them up here in the bay.
Will take ya 10 min max, from IBP, stay away from the crowds and you should have steady hook ups. We got em good today! Good luck!
Turned off yesterday, we ran around the entire lake and got one fish for our efforts.  Saw one other boat land a fish.  I should have run out to Slyville!!!!
that is not what I wanted to hear I still have not made it out there yet  waiting for my big boat to get fixed.....
Sorry Terry, I wish it was a better day out there, trust me  Still lots of time though, they'll turn back on.
Hey Terry.  I had a buddy who did very well yesterday away from the packs. He found a school of active fish is all. Luck of th draw. As Bill said, there's lots of time still.

We played the same game.  Outside of the packs, infront of the packs, behind the packs, lol.  If you find an active school of fish you'll do just fine.  Unlucky day I guess, we all have them!  (Although I did clean up on rock bass and perch at the end of the day, lol)
My buddies also got into them pretty good. Nowhere near the pack at all. Same deal, found a lucky school that wanted to play. Otherwise, it was a pretty slow day from what I hear.  S.

I got out for a little bit after work on Friday night and found fish but they would not commit.  Only things biting were herring.  Got a bunch of those..  Mmmmm.  Love the way they taste. Just kidding.  We threw them all back.
Chris, did you and your wife walk by my place 2 days ago?  I swear I saw you across the street, lol.
Nope. If I saw you I would say hey. Been busy swimming in pool for past 3 days.  Love this weather
